first_story_block:
The King looked out the window. He was hungry, and craving something new.

But what? He'd already tried chicken, duck, goose, turkey, unicorn, lamb, leg of dragon (which had been quite filling), veal, griffon drumsticks, frog legs, and walrus (which the King did not care for at all).

Suddenly, a flash of red outside the window caught his eye. A firebird!

The King decided what he would like to have for lunch today...

"William!" he bellows.

"Yes, sir?" you reply.

"Bring me a firebird!"

action_results.result:
"Yes, your Majesty," you answer, and scurry off to find the King's lunch.

Of course, you're going to need some equipment to hunt with.

You already have your trusty shortsword, but since the firebird is, well, a bird, it would be advisable to bring a bow and arrows as well.

You could bring a regular bow, of average strength.

The greatbow is more powerful, but you have fewer arrows for it.

Either way, you have a limited amount of arrows, so whichever you choose, use them wisely.
You choose to bring your regular bow. You take it and set off on your hunt.
You choose to bring the greatbow. You take it and set off.

action_results.action: What? Are you kidding? I quit!
action_results.result:
"What? Are you kidding? I quit!" you yell, storming out of the palace.

As you stomp off across the landscape, you begin to realize exactly what you've done.

You've just quit your job, your source of livelihood, and seriously ticked off the King in the process! Now what?

You go back to the palace and grovel.

"Please, your Majesty, I didn't mean it..."

Before you can finish, the King yells, "Guards! Seize him!"

They drag you off to the dungeon, where you remain for the rest of your days.

You hear the Queen of Karria, a neighboring kingdom, is looking for a new Royal Hunter. Fortunately, you are able to hitch a ride in a cart to Karria.

You walk into the palace. "Hello," you say to the receptionist. "I'm here to apply for the Royal Hunter job."

"Take this application," the receptionist says in a bored tone. You do so, and sit down to fill it out.

Under 'Why did you leave your last place of employment?' you put 'Unreasonable demands'.

You fill it out and hand it to the receptionist, who glances at it briefly. "You're in luck. The Queen herself is interviewing prospective Hunters, and she's not busy right now, so I'll send you back there."

The Queen sits at a dest, and motions for you to have a seat. "What is your name?"

"William Bardin," you answer.

"Do you have any former experience?"

"Yes, I was Royal Hunter for the King of Binton."

"Why did you leave?"

"He constantly made outrageous demands. I had to track down a unicorn once!"

"Ah. And what makes you think things will be different here?"

Choose your answer wisely!

action_results.action: I didn't think there was anyone else who had such weird tastes
action_results.result:
"I didn't think there was anyone else who had such weird tastes," you answer.

"WHAT?!" the Queen yells. "I'll have you know that unicorn is among the most delicious meats in the world! Call me weird, will you?!"

You back slowly away.

"Out!" she shouts, and you comply.

You leave the palace, and spend the rest of your life wandering the roads, hunting for your food, and constantly on the move. It's not a bad life, although not the one you had intended on living.

action_results.action: The King was greedy. I don't think you eat as much as he.
action_results.result:
"The King was greedy. I don't think you eat as much as he," you reply.

She looks pleased. "Well, then, you are hired. You start tomorrow."

You are glad to be back to work.

Unfortunately, the first thing she asks for...

...is firebird.

Oh well.

action_results.action: I wouldn't mind going to the ends of the earth for someone of your radiant beauty
action_results.result:
"I wouldn't mind going to the ends of the earth for someone of your radiant beauty," you say.

She is obviously flattered. "Well, aren't you the gentleman!" she exclaims. "You are hired! You start tomorrow!"

You are glad to be back to work. Eventually, you and the Queen fall in love and marry, making you the King of the land!

Rather a step up from Royal Hunter, wouldn't you say?
